segments.text: Excuse me , I need to get to Cambridge today .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Would you like to go by train or by bus ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I am not sure , which one is better ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: The bus is cheaper but also slower . It will take about two-and-a-half hours .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: And how long does the train take ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: If you take the fast train , it will take about 50 minutes .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Where do I catch the train ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: The trains for Cambridge leave from King's Cross Station . They run approximately every half hour . Most trains to Cambridge go from Platform 9 .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: How do I get to King's Cross ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: The best way is to take an underground tube train directly to King's Cross . The Underground station is just round the corner from here .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Can you show me on the map ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It is very easy . Just turn right when you leave and then turn right again at the first crossroads . The entrance to the Underground station is about 50 meters further on .
segments.speaker: S2
